name: Clin T Vulva
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and extension information on the primary tumor are available, use the extension information to assign the T in preference to a statement of FIGO stage. 
* See the Registrar Notes when FIGO stage is the only information available. If the only available information is FIGO Stage III [NOS, A, B, or C], assign T1 [NOS].  
* If the only available information is FIGO IVA, assign T1 [NOS] if based on positive nodes and T3 if based on extension or  unknown basis. 

**Note 2:**  FIGO no longer includes Stage 0 (Tis) for this site.

**Note 3:**  FIGO Stage I, IA and IB are defined by the following:
* Size of tumor 
* Involvement of vulva OR vulva and perineum
* Depth of stromal invasion.

**Note 4:**  The depth of invasion is defined as the measurement of the tumor from the epithelial-stromal junction of the adjacent most superficial dermal papilla to the deepest point of invasion. (1)

**Note 5:** T3 is not used by FIGO. They label it T4. If you have a record which states T4, assign T3. (1)

**Note 6:** FIGO Stage IVA is assigned based on tumor extension and/or regional lymph node involvement.  
* Code primary tumor extension based on a physician's statement of FIGO Stage IVA if it is based on primary tumor extension or the basis is unknown.
footnotes: (1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 198
rows:
Clinical evaluation performed but unknown results or extension not stated
Clinical evaluation performed but results not documented in patient record
Size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary site

Carcinoma in situ (preinvasive carcinoma)
Intraepithelial neoplasia Grade III (VIN III)
Tumor confined to vulva or vulva and perineum

Note: T1 has subcategories of T1a and T1b. Assign T1 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Vulva and perineum:  Stromal invasion but depth of invasion in millimeters not stated

Invasive carcinoma confined to:
    Musculature
    Submucosa
    Vulva including skin

Localized, NOS

Only information available is Stage III [NOS, A, B, or C]
Only information available is Stage IVA based on nodes only-see T3 for further information 

FIGO Stage I [NOS]

Stated as T1 [NOS]
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension and with stromal invasion no greater than 1.0 mm

Vulva and perineum: Stromal invasion less than or equal to 1 mm

FIGO Stage IA

Stated as T1a
Tumor greater than 2 cm or with stromal invasion greater than 1 mm

Vulva and perineum: Stromal invasion greater than 1 mm

FIGO Stage IB

Stated as T1b

Tumor of any size with extension to adjacent perineal structures: 
    Anus
    Lower third urethra 
    Lower third vagina

Perianal skin
Urethra, NOS 
Vagina NOS

FIGO Stage II

Stated as T2

Tumor of any size with extension to the following structures:
    Bladder mucosa
    Fixed to pelvic bone
    Rectal mucosa
    Upper 2/3 urethra
    Upper 2/3 vagina

Bladder wall or bladder, NOS (including mucosa)
Perineal body
Rectal wall or rectum, NOS (including mucosa)

Further contiguous extension

FIGO Stage IVA based on extension 
     Or unknown whether based on extension or nodes

Stated as T3
Clinical T is not defined for the specific site/histology

No clinical evaluation of primary tumor
Cancer first detected on surgical resection
Unknown if any clinical assessment performed
